strings.Value: "You're insane. Stop this, before it's too late!"
"I'll stop you, one way or another."
"Fine. I'll go. Let us see the worth of your words."
"Another ambush? It seems like you take me not for a hound, but for some foolish chicken."
"Don't get your hopes up. I won't dance to your tune."
"I know your story now, Nyrissa. Unfortunately, what I don't know is how to help you overcome the curse..."

"One more... grain... And another... grain... This one took a hundred years to obtain. And that one was just a week. The first bears the blood of three generations, burned in war. The second... just two well-chosen words and one little betrayal..."

{n}The nymph's face suddenly flashes with anger as she clutches her cup.{/n} "This will never end! Never!" {n}She drops her head, silent for a long while, before she lifts her gaze to you with an odd, almost dreamy smile.{/n} "Do you see this cup? It has a name, you know — the Apology. Within it is the Stag Lord, and his crazy dream to become a king and take me as his queen. And Armag, and his never-born barbarian empire. Who will fall in next? {g|Pitax}Pitax{/g}, and its peacock king? Or you?"
{n}Nyrissa's gaze goes cold and hard.{/n} "What is this — a dream? Or is someone actually playing games with me?!"

{n}Nyrissa — seemingly the real Nyrissa, conscious rather than dreaming — looks at you with curiosity and approval.{/n} "So... this IS a dream. But you have entered it from reality. Exquisite. Very reminiscent of the methods I typically use. For a thousand years, none have come so close to me... and I assure you, none ever will again."

"But you... I like you more and more, my hound. Perhaps I have no need of that stupid peacock anymore. I could let you tear him apart, if you wish. I know where a tool lies that will let you clip his wings — the evidence of his crimes. Something he's been hiding from his {g|Pitax}Pitaxian{/g} allies... but he could not hide it from me. Remember this name: {g|Whiterose Abbey}Whiterose Abbey{/g}. That is where Irovetti would usually meet with me, in the past — and the place where you will find your tool against him."
"Oh, you can always refuse. Then, the peacock will simply peck you to death and gain your kingdom for his own. And I still gain another grain for the Apology."
"My brave, brave hound... We will get along nicely, I daresay."
"So cranky. It is not like I demand you go alone. Take along your silly servants, if you wish."
"I have had strange dreams recently... of times before the curse... and a meeting that never occurred..."

{n}Nyrissa's gaze goes cold and hard.{/n} "What is this — a dream? Or is someone actually playing games with me?! Speaking words that pierce like arrows, teasing me with the hope of salvation beyond my reach..."
